intro: Pleurothallis microchila, commonly known as the miniature orchid, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Colombia. It is a small, epiphytic orchid that thrives in humid, shaded environments within the canopy of rainforests. The plant features delicate, narrow leaves and produces tiny, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale yellow. Its compact size and unique floral structure make it a popular choice among orchid enthusiasts. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is often cultivated in controlled environments to ensure its survival.
